Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Short-lived \Short"-lived`\, a. Not living or lasting long; being of short continuance; as, a short-lived race of beings; short-lived pleasure; short-lived passion. [1913 Webster]

short-lived adj : enduring a very short time; "the ephemeral joys of childhood"; "a passing fancy"; "youth's transient beauty"; "love is transitory but at is eternal"; "fugacious blossoms" [syn: {ephemeral}, {passing}, {transient}, {transitory}, {fugacious}]
